bug.short_desc: mkudffs: Error: Cannot open device : Value too large for defined data type
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Version udftools-1.2-1.fc25.i686 cannot open large files. Regression from version udftools-1.0.0b3-31.fc24.i686
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 1.2-1
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1.dd if=/dev/zero of=/work/ISO1.iso bs=2048 count=12207031 2.mkudffs /work/ISO1.iso 3.
Actual results: mkudffs: Error: Cannot open device '/work/ISO1.iso': Value too large for defined data type
Expected results: start=0, blocks=16, type=RESERVED start=16, blocks=3, type=VRS start=19, blocks=237, type=USPACE start=256, blocks=1, type=ANCHOR start=257, blocks=16, type=PVDS start=273, blocks=1, type=LVID start=274, blocks=12206499, type=PSPACE start=12206773, blocks=1, type=ANCHOR start=12206774, blocks=239, type=USPACE start=12207013, blocks=16, type=RVDS start=12207029, blocks=1, type=ANCHOR
Additional info: Version 1.3 does not have the problem
udftools-1.3-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-6123c56bf7
Thank you for the report. I usually want to avoid rebases in released Fedoras, but this time it probably makes sense.

udftools-1.3-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-6123c56bf7
udftools-1.3-1.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
